description:
Scenario:
=======

1. Login Openstack via Dashbaord.
2. Launch in instance and wait for it to become Active.
3. Click project tab (example: admin) --> Intance
4. Select an instance --> Actions --> View Log

Result:
=====
1. Check the attached screenshot

Reproduced several times 100% reproducible
title: Dashboard usability issue. An empty Instance log populated with a question mark.

comments.content:
Scenario:
=======

1. Login Openstack via Dashbaord.
2. Launch in instance and wait for it to become Active.
3. Click project tab (example: admin) --> Intance
4. Select an instance --> Actions --> View Log

Result:
=====
1. Check the attached screenshot

Reproduced several times 100% reproducible
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nmagnezi

comments.content: That question mark is what's being returned by the Nova API, so the bug is on Nova's end. I suspect it may be either the particular type of instance/image you're using or a configuration error.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gabriel-hurley

comments.content: I don't see how closing this bug improves the situation. If it's a Nova bug, lets move it to Nova. If we need more logs, ask and we'll deliver them. Can you specify which Nova API is used to get this and we'll see if we can reproduce this issue via the API?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ykaul

comments.content: I *did* add Nova to the bug report.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gabriel-hurley

comments.content:
This actually looks like an issue with your image. Something in the guest appears to be writing '?' (or maybe a random unicode character) to the serial console.

The cli version of the command is:

nova console-log <instance_uuid>

If it is also producing a ? then I suspect that it is actually your image doing this.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content:
It seems like it does returned from nova api:

# nova console-log 101c48cc-9f8f-4ad1-ae78-a56ce008f2dc
?

I'm not sure if it comes from the image, I tried other images (Fedora 17 for example) and the instance log was blank.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nmagnezi

comments.content:
The issue is with the RHEL / Centos we need to edit menu.lst and inittab as shown below.

http://serverfault.com/questions/257962/kvm-guest-installed-from-console-but-how-to-get-to-the-guests-console
http://blog.domb.net/?p=56
http://prefetch.net/blog/index.php/2009/06/17/redirecting-the-centos-and-fedora-linux-console-to-a-serial-port-virsh-console-edition/
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v
